body_html:
You're on the right track, what you need to do then is:

pip uninstall protobuf
cd google/protobuf
./autogen.sh
./configure
make
make check
sudo make install

Then update your LD_LIBRARY_PATH as it says in google/protobuf/src/README.md
Then

cd python
python setup.py build --cpp_implementation
python setup.py test --cpp_implementation
sudo python setup.py install --cpp_implementation

And you should have tensorfflow working with the fast version of protobuf. If you're missing packages, look at the READMEs. A couple notes:
-If you want >64MB protobuf, before you do any of this, and before you build tensorflow, you have to update the protobuf file coded_stream.h as described in #582.
-When you exit python after having loaded tensorflow, it segfaults, but I think everything before works fine.

body:
You're on the right track, what you need to do then is:

pip uninstall protobuf
cd google/protobuf
./autogen.sh
./configure
make
make check
sudo make install

Then update your `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` as it says in `google/protobuf/src/README.md`
Then 

cd python
python setup.py build --cpp_implementation
python setup.py test --cpp_implementation
sudo python setup.py install --cpp_implementation

And you should have tensorfflow working with the fast version of protobuf. If you're missing packages, look at the `README`s. A couple notes:
-If you want >64MB protobuf, before you do any of this, and before you build tensorflow, you have to update the protobuf file `coded_stream.h` as described in #582.
-When you exit python after having loaded tensorflow, it segfaults, but I think everything before works fine.
